page.title: 10CHANGING TIMES
page.content: We interviewed 10 elderly people about their early lives, compared with the present. WORK-Some people were working when they were very young because the family was hard up. Many worked much longer, harder hours than today for Â£120 per year! Unlike now, there were plenty of jobs to go round, of similar type as today. LEISURE-there was less organised entertainment than today. People entertained themselves, by going for walks. Girls played hop-scotch, netball, hockey and skipping games. Women and girls would knit and sew. Boys played cricket, football, rugby and tennis.Today all of these are still available, but also the cadet forces, outdoor persuits courses and school-organised activities are freely available.
